title: Creation of Man and Woman
shortSummary: Genesis chapter 2 provides a detailed account of the creation of man and woman, emphasizing God's intentional design and provision for humanity. It introduces the Garden of Eden, the special command regarding the tree of knowledge, and the institution of marriage, highlighting the intimate relationship between God, man, and woman.
timeline: c. 4000 BC - Creation of Man and Woman

keyCharacters.name: Adam
keyCharacters.description: The first man formed by God from the dust of the ground, given life by God's breath, and placed in the Garden of Eden.

keyCharacters.name: Eve
keyCharacters.description: The first woman created by God from Adam's rib to be his helper and companion.

definitions.definition: Set apart as holy or consecrated, as God did with the seventh day after creation.
A suitable helper or companion, indicating a partner who complements and supports.
A living being with life and consciousness, referring to man after God breathed life into him.

definitions.term: Tree of knowledge of good and evil
definitions.definition: The specific tree in Eden whose fruit God commanded Adam not to eat, symbolizing obedience and the moral boundary set by God.

outline.heading: Completion of Creation and Rest
outline.description: God finishes the creation of the heavens and the earth and rests on the seventh day, blessing and sanctifying it as a model for human rest and worship.

outline.heading: Preparation for Man’s Creation
outline.description: The earth is described before man’s creation, highlighting the absence of rain and the presence of a mist that waters the ground, setting the stage for human life.

outline.heading: Creation and Placement of Man
outline.description: God forms man from dust, breathes life into him, and places him in the Garden of Eden to cultivate and keep it, demonstrating man’s unique creation and responsibility.

outline.heading: Command Regarding the Trees
outline.description: God commands Adam regarding the freedom to eat from all trees except the tree of knowledge of good and evil, introducing the principle of obedience and consequence.

outline.heading: Creation of Woman and Institution of Marriage
outline.description: God creates woman from Adam’s rib to be his helper, establishing the foundation for marriage as a union where two become one flesh, highlighting companionship and unity.

application: Observe the principle of Sabbath rest by setting aside time to worship and reflect on God's work.
Recognize the importance of obedience to God's commands as a foundation for life and blessing.
Value the God-ordained institution of marriage as a sacred union designed for companionship and mutual support.
Appreciate the unique creation of humanity in God's image and live responsibly as stewards of His creation.

keyVerses.text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the special creation of man, uniquely formed by God and given life directly from Him.

keyVerses.text: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the command and consequence that introduces the moral responsibility of man before God.

keyVerses.text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
keyVerses.significance: This verse lays the biblical foundation for marriage and the lifelong union between husband and wife.
